detailsOfAchievement: Organization right from its inception has focused on advanced and alternative farming practices to improve the livelihood condition of farmers It has adopted the policy of inclusive growth by encouraging women groups and also small and marginal farmers The key focus areas have remained as follows Advanced and Alternative Agriculture promotion Land and Water Management and development Capacity Building Market research and market linkages. Value edition of agriculture products AWAM has long term association with NABARD for implementing various projects He organization is working in two states Gujarat and Madhya Pradesh At present AWAM is implementing three watershed projects in Dahod and Chhotaudepur districts under Indo German Watershed Development Project in Gujarat. Apart from it AWAM is also implementing three WADI project in Pavijetpur block of Chhotaudepur district in which it has covering more than 3000 tribal farmers of the district. Accompanied by watershed and wadi development activities we are also promoting organic farming in this area of Gujarat In Bhabhara block of Alirajpur AWAM is implementing the NISARG WADI project in which we have established 1000 acres fruit orchard land and covered 1000 family AWAM has also worked with Gujarat government water supply department (GWSSB) to provide drinking water facilities in schools and village habitat Under this programme we have covered more than 100 schools and 35 villages under house connectivity AWAM is implementing 54 drinking water schemes in 34 villages of Dahod district which will be going to cover more than 1300 household with the financial assistance of Tribal Sub Plan Dahod Besides it AWAM has established four farmers producer organization with the support of NABARD by providing required assistance and resources like input, technical knowledge, financial resources and infrastructure in Pavi Jetpur block of Chhoaudepur district. The purpose of establishing FPOs is to enhance productivity and realize higher return for their produce through collective action and to support tribal farmers linked them directly with market so that farmers get good price for their produce. AWAM through its managerial support prepared farmers for running and governing these FPOs in future AWAM has recently take responsibility of construction and maintenance of eight vegetable collection centers in Chhotaudepur district under Vanbandhu Kalyan Yojana announced by Tribal development department Gujarat. AWAM has successfully scaled up its activities in natural resource sector with a clear vision and planning. Sustainability of the organization is highly dependent on its vision and growth plan. AWAM being established with a purpose and communities have given much great response to its initiatives with huge amount of peoples contribution it is sure that the activities and organization are moving towards greater sustainability.

ngoName: B V Patel Pharmaceutical Education and Research Development Centre
address: B V Patel Pharmaceutical Education and Research Development Centre Opposite Zydus Hospital Sarkhej Gandhinagar HighwayThaltejAhmedabad Gujarat 380054
title: B V Patel Pharmaceutical Education and Research Development Centre
detailsOfAchievement: The B. V. Patel Pharmaceutical Education & Research Development (PERD) Centre was established in 1989 by the Gujarat Branch of the Indian Pharmaceutical Association with the help of Indian Pharmaceutical Companies and the Government of Gujarat, in the memory of late Shri. B. V. Patel, who was the first Drug Controller of Gujarat and truly considered as the father of drug legislation in India. PERD Centre is Indiaâ€™s first multidisciplinary research institute, dedicated to the pursuit of excellence in the pharmaceutical sciences. The focus of centre is on three aspects namely; Basic Research, Services to Industries and Continuing Education Program. PERD Centre brings together a diverse interdisciplinary team of experts in the basic science, chemistry, biotechnology, pharmacology, analytical, herbals and other areas of pharmaceuticals sciences. Industries Commissionerate, Government of Gujarat has recognized PERD Centre as Centre of Excellence (COE) for providing technical assistance to small & medium industries for quality control and quality assurance standards for drugs & drug formulations, and herbal drugs. PERD Centre has opened up for collaborations with industry both in India and abroad for developing formulations, synthesis of compound libraries in the therapeutic areas like Cancer, Inflammation, Diabetes and Infectious diseases, etc. Equipped with the latest and best R & D facilities, highly qualified scientific & technical personnel & regular education, training and developmental activities, PERD today is an internationally recognized research institute providing the Pharmaceutical Industry and Academia the opportunity and resources to undertake the latest in research and development in pharmaceutical sciences. The focus of research at PERD Centre is on drug discovery (synthetic, herbal, biotherapeutics), dug development, drug delivery, drug toxicity and efficacy. Our expertise is in the areas of â€“ standardization of herbal drugs, impurity profiling of API, formulation development, mammalian cell culture studies, toxicity and pharmacokinetic studies in animals. Over the past few years, PERD Centre has produced a number of publications in peer-reviewed journals, national and international patents and awards thereby recognizing the potential and capabilities of the institute and its faculties. The Centre also has a distinction of getting research grants both from State and Central Government.

detailsOfAchievement: Habitat Forum (INHAF) successfully developed a study and a research methodology based on themes such poor defining poverty line, investment watch, â€˜how city delivers its entitlements for poorâ€™. We also compiled and printed a book covering six organizations of informal sector workers from Pune in Marathi and English languages. Along with other partners and stakeholders INHAF organized â€˜Zopadpatti Punarvasan Parishadâ€™ in Pune to address issue of rural and urban housing. We gave presentation to Govt of India in addressing its role at Habitat III which is the United Nations Conference on Housing and Sustainable Urban Development to take place in Quito, Ecuador, in October 2016. INHAF has taken initiative in developing strategy for Indian Civil Society based on themes and issues which are uncovered in national policies, programs and development actions. INHAF with its partner organization has piloted a project on promotion of bamboo as an alternative construction material for affordable housing for poor Way Forward Chennai is one of our initiatives on strategy development for resilient cities using case study of Chennai for its recent floods.

detailsOfAchievement: We are working on the issues like Health, Education, Women empowerment, Self Help Groups, Agriculture and Environment. Especially our focus is to provide equal chances to youth of unorganized sector, women, children and economically deprived community in business, education and health. Encouraging training program for people to develop independent business was organized by organization. We are also joined with activities like natural resources management and agriculture. Our main strength lies in our experienced team thus we can implement our program successfully from grassroots level. During establishment of organization we have started our work in Amreli district to make change in situation of health and education as per founderâ€™s ideas and vision, later on we have included work of primary education and reproductive and child health activities. We have been discussed to join livelihood program for women after seven years of establishment and started vocational training for women. Organization also included activities of built house for Agariya who are living on peripheral area of sea, renovation of historical places and educational researches. Now as on experience organization started activities of natural resource management, formation of SHGs for self-employment and skill development trainings. We have also joined with capacity building activity of Gram Sanjivani Samiti in Bardoli block of Surat district.
